{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Standard Microsystems |model=CX870 |revision=-3H |availability= |type=module,audio module |fcc_date=07/20/2011 |fcc_id=ZQO-CX8703H |ic_id=2581A-CX8703H |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn= |cpu1_brand=BridgeCo |cpu1_model=DM870A |cpu1_cspeed=240 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29GL640EHT2I-70G |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H57V1262GTR-60C |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag=yes |serial=yes |wi1_chip1_brand=BridgeCo |wi1_chip1_model=DM870A |wi1_chip2_brand=BridgeCo |wi1_chip2_model=Eagle |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=SMSC |eth_chip2_model=8700C |lan_ports= |wan_ports= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |default_ssid= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |802dot11_protocols=bg |oui= }} '''JukeBlox Networked Media Module'''
The DM870 is a triple-core network media processor with an ARM9 core :at 240MHz, Security Core at 160MHz, and Audio Engine at 160MHz. The processor also has an integrated 802.11b/g MAC/BB, Ethernet MAC, :LCD, USB 2.0 controller, S/PDIF output, and SDIO host controller. Specs from the BridgeCo site [http://www.bridgeco.com/network-media-processors/ here].
*The RF chip [http://www.wellington-partners.com/wp/downloads/pfn/bridgeco/2008/080107_bri3.pdf appears] to be a rebadged Thomson 6201C.
